Reviews.Title: “Re-visit to this Hotel and still a great option!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBerlin
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to this hotel and wasn't disappointed. The hotel is just off Nollendorfplatz so the U bahn station is just 100m away giving you great transport links - lines U1 U2 U3 & U4. Its is so easy to get to the centre and all the main attractions there. The room was functional - very clean, comfortable bed, separate shower room and in-room safe separate seating and work desk area - there are no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. really pleasing is that this is NOT a noisy hotel which allows you to sleep in a little if you need. My room was at the back of the hotel. I didn't use the WiFi as I made use of the hotel Web access which I found to be always available. The breakfast times are quite rigid so if needs be there is a cafe right opposite where you can fill up. If you need a restaurant near the hotel you just need to walk around the corner on to Maassenstrasse - there is a huge selection of restaurants all the way up to Winterfeldplatz. There is also a huge selection of bars on your doorstep. If you require a supermarket - the is a Kaiser's on Nollendorfplatz. The location of the hotel makes it an easy walk up to the "must visit" KaDeWe and on to the Kudamm - the famous shopping area. If you want a bus tour these can be picked up on Tauentzienstrasse (outside KaDe We). Taking everything into account - price, location, quality of the room - I found this hotel to be an ideal choice for my visit to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with basic amenities but closer to U bahn station”
Reviews.Author: ckanchan
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel for the wi-fi facility and due to proximity from the U bahn station during my three days trip to Berlin. No doubt this hotel is stone throw away from Nollendorfplatz station. However, my disappointment was that wi-fi in the room was not working. I was assured that it will be fixed next day, however, it was not fixed. Later I came to know that other guests too could not avail internet facility in the room. I had to come to lobby for accessing internet, where it was working. The room was neat, clean and tidy. Every day, room would be cleaned without having to request for clean up, which I like in the hotel. The room was small but enough for me but not bathroom. I wish bathroom could be bigger. The breakfast was not included in the room rate. Buffet breakfast served in the ground floor was too basic. Morning and day staffs were pleasant, friendly and spoke fluent English. However, staff during night was not able to communicate good English. Not fault of this hotel, but due to mistake of my booking agent, I had considerable difficulty in finding this hotel as I was searching this hotel in some other district (Neukolln) as this was what written in the hotel voucher. I had difficulty talking over the phone with the night staff due to his poor English skill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean, Central”
Reviews.Author: MrFishwick
Reviews.Content: Great central location (nollendorf platz) and easy to get around berlin. Good size single rooms, comfortable beds, quiet, clean, great bathroom, safe in room. Breakfast was a good selection of cold-cuts, cheese, boiled eggs etc. Nice helpful staff, excellent value for money. Would stay again - recommended

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again...”
Reviews.Author: hkyd
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights in August 2011. Overall, our experience in the hotel was quite poor. First, the decor in the rooms is quite dated and unconsciously kitschy. Although the rooms are clean, they are in need of redecorating! The worst thing in the hotel was definitely the Wifi connection. It was totally unreliable, slow, inconsistent, and allowed access to some web sites and not to others! In this day and age, a hotel should provide this service at a higher level for its guests. The staff at the hotel were also quite lukewarm and unfriendly. As English-speaking tourists, we felt somewhat unwelcome in the hotel. The hotel also has a policy of taking your key every time you leave. A few times when we came back late from the bars, we felt that the staff were giving us dirty looks. Since the hotel is located on a gay street in Berlin, this was a little surprising! Finally, the check-out at the hotel was 10:00 a.m. Having travelled extensively, we have never heard of such an early check-out! The woman at the desk did, however, let us check out at 10:30 a.m., and she also kept our bags for a few hours. Overall though, they should allow guests to leave closer to noon. All in all, there are better hotels in the area, so shop around!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,and good value, in the right location”
Reviews.Author: PaulofLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Because we were going to a birthday party, just round the corner, this hotel ticked all the boxes. And for 70 euros a room, in a city like Berlin, good value for money. In London the same type of place would be at least £120.00 per room, if not more. Next time we go there, we'll stay there again. Close by there are lot a good cafes and bars, so if you didn't feel like breakfast in the hotel, then for around 6 euros, you can a good breakfst elsewhere. We had a room each, and both rooms had new bathrooms, and looked like the rest of the room had been freshly painted. And also new floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great transport links”
Reviews.Author: JonnyBerlin
Reviews.Content: This is a medium sized budget hotel - but NOT basic by any means. The room was of ample size and comfortable with a great bathroom. Its clean and quiet and in a great location. Nollendorfplatz U-Bahn station is 100m from the hotel - line U2 will take you west, east and direct to the centre. Its a short walk up to KaDeWe and all the shops on the Kudamm. There is a huge variety of good quality restaurants just around the corner - also there is a great cafe directly opposite offering great breakfast food with fantastic friendly service. Didn;t get up in time to get breakfast in the hotel as there was a strict cut off time. This turned out to be a great base for sampling the delights of this part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: ejs072047
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Berlin and we were looking for a hotel that was moderate in price, near mass transit lines, and in a quiet area. This hotel met all the requirements. We stayed 3 nights and paid 84 Euros a night (about $110). It is located minutes (like 3) from the Nollendorfplatz U-bahn station. The staff was pleasant and helpful, and our room (in front 2nd floor street side) was clean and quiet with an en suite bath. We did not have the breakfast nor turn on the TV. Out in the morning and back at night. We grabbed a comfort food take out dinner right across the street from a very nice Turkish gentleman and ate in our room. For more information about our trip to Berlin and this hotel you can check out our travel journal blog at: http://edjoseph.blogspot.com/2010/09/airlifted-into-berlin.html No adverts - just the ramblings of a couple of retired people exploring Europe.

Reviews.Title: “nice, really 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: gaytravel10
Reviews.Content: The location is central (nollendorf platz) and easy to get to anywhere in berlin. The best was breakfast. Very tasty, big choice, quite good coffee as for Germany.Nice staff, good localization and big clean rooms. Good value for money. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good value comfort and space, with no frills”
Reviews.Author: hal9000Discovery
Reviews.Content: Having had a very expensive and disappointing experience over New Year 2010 at the nearby Axel Hotel, we tried staying at the Sachsenhof for Easter upon the recommendation of a friend. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The Sachsenhof is a spacious, rambling, quiet hotel, fronting on Motzstraße and arranged around an inner courtyard of traditional Berlin apartment style buildings. It has no airs or graces. What you see is what you get. The hotel seems very well maintained. Our room appeared to have been recently refurbished, with new functional furniture, carpet and décor. It was a generous size with a high ceiling and a large window opening onto the courtyard giving plenty of light and fresh air. There was a seating area with table and comfy chairs and a new flat panel TV (remote available from reception with 5€ deposit). It would have been good to have had a kettle and mugs in the room – although there are plenty of cafes nearby, so their absence was not a problem. The room had a small safe (not quite big enough for a laptop). There was no internet in-room, but a free fast public walk-up terminal (no chair to sit at as you browse) is available on the ground floor near reception, and handy if you’re just checking mail on the go. The compact en suite bathroom was stylishly done with an attractive contemporary finish and decent quality fittings. There was plenty of hot water and all the plumbing worked as it should. Heating in the room worked well, was quiet and controllable. Housekeeping was discreet and efficient, with overall cleanliness very good. Front of house day reception staff were professional, friendly and efficient. The night reception staff will let you back in when you ring the bell, as your room key has to be left at reception when you go out. Breakfast starts early and finishes at 10 – which can be limiting if you’ve been enjoying the typically late Berlin nightlife. We didn’t catch breakfast on this trip so can’t comment directly, although we heard from others that it’s ok and worth the 6€ additional charge. With affordable rates, well kept decent spec rooms and a great location in the heart of Schoneberg, you couldn’t go wrong with the Sachsenhof. We’ll certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “decent choice for gay tourists”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right in the heart of the gay area but it´s not a gay hotel. the room was a bit small, but clean, good heat, everything worked. mini safe in room was good to have. i had a room facing the interior courtyard, which was quiet. it´s probably quiet facing the street too. what i liked was the location. 1 minute walk to nollendorfplatz ubahn subway station. about 15 minutes walk to wittenburg platz, where the kadewe department store is. there are quite a few restaurants open very late all over the area, and a few mini markets too. there is an internet cafe about 2 minutes walk away which was open til late and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “ok but very boring”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in a small dbl room. the room was warm, well cleaned, bathroom had a tub and was clean and well functioning too. breakfast was ok, with a decent selection of breads, cereals etc. tv had only german channels and there was no internet available in the rooms. the person in the night watch, in charge of letting late arrivals in, was a bit suspicious and not too friendly, but this might be a language barrier thing too. even though there are all sorts of services in the vicinity, including a supermarket open until 24.00, i found the area around nollendorfplatz very boring. would not choose this hotel if I wanted to experience any culture in berlin. luckily the u-bahn (line U3) station is a stone's throw away, which makes this hotel a option worth considering if you want to be somewhat in the city but have errands at the freie universität campus, which is also on the U3 line. would be 3/5 if they had internets and english-language TV (and if I hadn't found the location so boring.)

Reviews.Title: “cant go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: slap bang in the gay area of berlin it has a mixed clientel. ive stayed here on many occasion. most rooms have now been refurbished to a good standard. they say you get what you pay for but with this place you cant go wrong. the newer rooms are light and airy, some with private bathrooms, pay less and you share a bathroom on the landings. its centrally located with a 2 minute walk to nollendorfplatz station. i cantcomment on the breakfast because ive never been awake at that time to try it. id happily recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a centralized location and was very affordable. The breakfast was filling and the service was friendly. It is close to the U-Bahn station and two stops away from the Zoo Bahnhof. There are a variety of restaurants nearby. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good position for travellers and the rooms are basic. The breakfast is wholesome and tasty and caters for all types of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved tghe Sachsenhof”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sachsenhof is a comfortable Hotel on Nollendorfstrasse in the heart of the gay nightlife area. The rooms are small and clean. Some have separate bathrooms which are also clean. Safe, secure, hospitable and inexpensive. You can't go wrong.
